verse.roman:
mada-cyudbhir gajānīkaiḥ
syandanair hema-mālibhiḥ
patty-aśva-saṅkulaiḥ sainyaiḥ
parītaḥ kuṇdīnaṁ yayau

synonyms: mada—liquid secreted from the forehead; cyudbhiḥ—exuding; gaja—of elephants; anīkaiḥ—with hordes; syandanaiḥ—with chariots; hema—golden; mālibhiḥ—decorated with garlands; patti—with foot soldiers; aśva—and horses; saṅkulaiḥ—crowded; sainyaiḥ—by armies; parītaḥ—accompanied; kuṇḍinam—to Kuṇḍina, Bhīṣmaka's capital; yayau—he went.
translation: King Damaghoṣa traveled to Kuṇḍina accompanied by armies of elephants exuding mada, chariots hung with golden chains, and numerous cavalry and infantry soldiers.
